ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

1= Not all discontented; 2= Occasional mild distress; 3= Moderately distressed; 4= Noticeably distressed; 5= Constantly negative
1= Not all active/lively; 2= Minimally active/lively; 3= Average; 4= Moderately active; 5= Highly active
1= Not sociable; 2= Minimally sociable; 3= Moderately sociable; 4= Frequently sociable; 5= Highly sociable
1 =Not characteristic; 2 =Minimally characteristic; 3= Somewhat characteristic; 4= Moderately characteristic; 5= Highly characteristic
1= Not at all demanding; 2= Minimally demanding; 3= Moderately demanding; 4= Very demanding; 5= Predominately demanding

1 =No mutual enjoyment and/or dyadic enthusiasm (no smiling, no animation); 2= Slight mutual enjoyment and/or dyadic enthusiasm (1 to 2 smiles, slight animation); 3= Moderate enjoyment and/or enthusiasm (3 to 4 smiles, moderate animation) across more than 1 situation/interaction, or one extended period of mutual enjoyment; 4= Considerable enjoyment and/or enthusiasm; 5= Characteristically joyful and enthusiastic.

1= No evidence of tension; 2= One instance of slight tension, such as in tone of voice. Frequency and intensity are low; 3= Tense tone of voice and few brief utterances as responses on occasion.Frequency of conflict is increased, but intensity is still low to moderate; 4= Dyad is more often conflictual. A rating of 4 is characterized by an increase in intensity from a rating of 3; 5= Tension or hostility is characteristic of the dyad,as seen by minimal or no response to initiations, hostile tone of voice, and high intensity and/or frequency.
1= Not at all positive; 2= Minimally positive (lukewarm); 3= Moderately positive; 4= Very positive; 5= Predominantly positive
1=Not at all negative; 2= Minimally negative; 3=Moderately negative; 4=Strikingly negative; 5=Predominantly negative
1= Not all characteristic; 2= Minimally sensitive/responsive; 3= Parent is moderately sensitive and responsive to child; 4= Mostly sensitive/responsive; 5= Highly sensitive/responsive
1= Not all intrusive; 2= Minimally intrusive; 3= Inconsistently intrusive; 4= Moderately intrusive; 5= Highly intrusive
1= Not at all detached; 2= Minimally detached; 3= Equally detached and involved; 4= Moderately detached; 5= Highly detached
1= Non-stimulating; 2= Minimally stimulating; 3= Moderately stimulating; 4= More than moderate; 5= Very stimulating
1= Unhappy or no affect; 2= Minimally positive; 3= Somewhat positive; 4= Moderately happy; 5= Gleeful, joyful, having a great time
